title: Airline pilots: industry wide FRE for 2013/14 onwards: summary

details.body:
Under the terms of the agreement between HMRC and BALPA, uniformed pilots, co-pilots and other uniformed flight deck crew may obtain the following expenses deductions for 2013/14 onwards (for details of the FRE applicable from 2006/07 to 2012/13 please see [EIM50050](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50050.htm)):
A FRE deduction of £1022 per year (reduced, if necessary, for employer contributions - see [EIM50059](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50059.htm)) **or** their actual, vouched expenses in respect of allowable items in that year (see [EIM50052](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50052.htm))
**plus**
If the employer requires pilots to wear a uniform, but does not provide one, the cost of replacing items of uniform (see [EIM50053](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50053.htm) and [EIM32475](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM32475.htm))
**plus**
If the employer does not provide a noise-cancelling headset, capital allowances for the cost of a noise-cancelling headset (see [EIM50054](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50054.htm))
**plus**
A further expenses deduction (EXP) of £110 per year for travel to certain specified events **or** the actual, allowable expenses of travel to those events (see [EIM50060](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50060.htm))
**plus**
The actual, allowable expenses of travelling to other temporary workplaces in the year (see [EIM50060](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50060.htm))
See also [EIM50045](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50045.htm) (BALPA subscriptions), [EIM50055](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50055.htm) (luggage) and [EIM50056](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM50056.htm) (computers).
